content: 2023 Singaporean television series ***The Landlady Singer*** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 包租婆要当歌手) is a 2023 Singaporean musical comedy series starring [Liu Lingling](/wiki/Liu_Lingling_(Singaporean_host)), [Wang Weiliang](/wiki/Wang_Weiliang), Xenia Tan, [Wang Yuqing](/wiki/Wang_Yuqing) and Lin Youfa. It airs every Tuesday, from 17 October 2023, at 8pm on [Mediacorp](/wiki/Mediacorp) [Channel 8](/wiki/Channel_8_(Singaporean_TV_channel)). ## Synopsis Wanting to earn extra cash to visit her son in London, Ying-jie decides to rent out her spare rooms to A-wei, a deliveryman, and Jiexi, a timid young woman. Ying-jie's nephew, Uncle Jian, moves in as well as his house is under renovation. Gradually unable to withstand the lifestyle habits of her new tenants, Ying-jie sets to chase them out of her house. However, despite their differences, the four eventually forms a bond through music and they decide to join a music competition as a quartet. ## Cast - [Liu Lingling](/wiki/Liu_Lingling_(Singaporean_host)) as Ying-jie - [Wang Weiliang](/wiki/Wang_Weiliang) as A-wei - Xenia Tan as Jiexi - [Wang Yuqing](/wiki/Wang_Yuqing) as Uncle Jian - Lin Youfa as Neighbour Wang ## Production The series was directed by Hu Heyi. Four songs were re-interpreted for the cast to sing. The music and scores were supervised and produced by local musician Bunz. This Singaporean television-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: The Landlady Singer
